sub_title: Senior Software Engineer @ L1NDA | Founder & CEO @ She's Coding
summary:
Software Engineer with 15+ years of experience, currently working as such at L1NDA, and running She's Coding, a nonprofit for women in tech. Looking to build connections and collaborations with people, organizations and companies that support that mission and want to join along in some way. 

More about me:
Computer scientist with a research and development background in vertical search engines, semantic technologies and web services (MSc in CS from University of Innsbruck, Austria). Worked as a researcher at the Semantic Technology Institute Innsbruck, before joining a young startup, 'seekda', where I helped build a semantic search engine for Web Services/APIs. As Head of Research I led a small research & development team and managed seekda's participation in several national and international research projects.

In my former lives I was a journalist, tried my hand in film editing, completed a bank training and worked shortly as a stock dealer. Some of these stints were more exciting than others, but they all allowed me to grow and learn a lot in a short time. With Computer Science, I have found my real passion - I love being able to be creative, work in great teams and build solutions to all kinds of problems, big and small.

After moving to Seattle in 2010 I concentrated on expanding my technical know-how and becoming a full-stack developer. I completed an intense Ruby on Rails bootcamp and worked as Ruby on Rails contract developer before joining Patent Navigation / Jolt Labs as Senior Software Engineer, working with Python/Django and Ember.js. I became actively engaged in the Seattle tech community through a number of women in tech related groups, most importantly through She’s Coding.

I relocated to Amsterdam end of 2018, where I joined the awesome L1NDA development team, and work on building up the European arm of She's Coding.

projects.title: Zarkadan
projects.description: Started at Startup Weekend Euro-Seattle, Zarkadan is a self-care game, helping you build better health habits. Zarkadan will be a monster who transforms as you improve or fail your health stats. As you get better at taking care of yourself, specifically working on projects you want to focus on, he gets softer and more pet-like, with animations and a story. If you start to lose focus, he gets meaner and sharper.

projects.title: INSEMTIVES - Insentives for Sementics
projects.description:
(Researcher, Motivation for participation through design)
Creating a critical mass of semantic content is a fundamental challenge that has received considerable attention in the past decade. The result is a maturing inventory of techniques and tools which primarily aim at the automation of the semantic content creation task as a means to lower costs and improve productivity. Whilst the quality of such automated approaches has consistently improved, it is still far from outweighing the required invested manual effort. The aim of INSEMTIVES is to bridge the gap between human and computational intelligence in the current semantic content authoring R&D landscape. In the scope of the project methodologies for the creation of semantic metadata for different types of Web resources, jointly exploiting human intelligence, community effects and machine processing will be developed.

projects.title: SOA4All
projects.description: SOA4All aims at realizing a world where billions of parties are exposing and consuming services via advanced Web technology: the main objective of the project is to provide a comprehensive framework that integrates complementary and evolutionary technical advances (i.e., SOA, context management, Web principles, Web 2.0 and semantic technologies) into a coherent and domain-independent service delivery platform.

projects.title: Service-Finder
projects.description: Today the Web is moving from a collection of static documents to a set of Web Services. In parallel, the role of Web users is also changing, with a shift from a passive, consuming role to an active one where users dynamically contribute to the creation of new contents (Web 2.0). Web Services and Web 2.0 are already being used to develop Web-based applications. However, up to now applications that use Web Services do not use the Web 2.0 approach. The European research project Service-Finder aims at developing a platform for service discovery in which Web Services are embedded in a Web 2.0 environment, thus hiding the technological complexity from the user. In particular, the objective of this project is to aggregate information coming from heterogeneous sources automatically.

projects.title: SWING
projects.description: SWING aimed at deploying Semantic Web Service (SWS) technology in the geospatial domain. In particular, we address two major obstacles that must be overcome for SWS technology to be generally adopted, i.e. to reduce the complexity of creating semantic descriptions and to increase the number of semantically described services.

authors.headline: Senior Software Engineer @ L1NDA | Founder & CEO @ She's Coding

profile_positions.description:
She’s Coding is a WA nonprofit organization with the main goal to help close the gender gap in tech. She's Coding operates on three main pillars: (1) An open-source website that educates women, allies and companies about the gender gap, developed in mentorship-based volunteer groups. (2) An offline and online safe community for women in tech. And (3), an effort to support women in their tech industry job searches via events and collaborations.

•	Growing the community: from zero to five locations and > 2,500 members (status Oct 2018)
•	Leading She's Coding's efforts towards making the organization a 501(c)3 accredited non-profit: building a board, creating bylaws and budgets
•	Organizing and running of Tech Women Rising conference
•	Creating partnerships with companies and with other women and minority in tech focused community organizations
•	Leading fundraising efforts to turn She's Coding into a self-sustainable organization
•	Leading development of, and working with volunteers on specifying features and general direction of our women in tech resources site shescoding.org
•	Organizing overall volunteer outreach and onboarding (dev, design, social media, project management)
•	Leading public She's Coding events, speaking at events, and participating at diversity centric events
•	Meeting with company representatives to discuss minority friendly hiring practices and inclusive culture creation
•	Writing development, design and content related stories/tasks for the She's Coding agile development boards
•	Developing in Python, Django, Ruby on Rails, HTML, CSS & Javascript
•	Coordinating volunteer development efforts, reviewing volunteer Github PRs

Technologies used: Python, Django, Ruby on Rails, HTML, CSS, Javascript, AWS Elastic Beanstalk, Adobe Illustrator
profile_positions.title: Founder & CEO

profile_positions.description:
L1NDA has two main products: L1NDA Planner, an established staff planner (3,000+ businesses – 30,000+ users – 11,000+ daily shifts), and L1NDA Connect, a young flex work marketplace that connects job seekers and businesses.

• Developed internal APIs for our mobile-first L1NDA Connect application
• Integrated external REST and SOAP APIs into both the legacy and the modern applications
• Built business logic for large-scale features such as an integration of both L1NDA products
• Led large feature technical design and architecture sessions
• Contributed to front-end and infrastructure code
• Created issue triage and investigation guidelines, in close collaboration with PO
• Worked in highly collaborative cross-functional team (backend, front-end, DevOps, design) 
• Represented development in cross-departmental teams; collaborated closely with product owner, commercial representatives, marketing, and other stakeholders
• Started out using Scrum and transitioned to Kanban. Participated in establishing our work processes
• Co-organized motivational & work alignment offsite event for 10-person team

Technologies used: Python 2 & 3, Django, Flask, SQLAlchemy, PostgreSQL, Javascript, Git, Jenkins, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Sentry, Datadog
profile_positions.title: Senior Lead Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Patent Navigation Inc. has created TurboPatent, the first tool designed specifically for patent attorneys. TurboPatent is a cloud-based, collaborative platform that enables attorneys to develop and produce patents faster and more effectively with greater consistency.

•	Leading CPM (Corporate Patent Manager) feature 'strike-team', acting as development lead, and collaborating closely with product owner and design
•	Leading daily standup, and acting as scrum master for fast-paced, bi-weekly sprints
•	Development of Web APIs in Django used by TurboPatent Ember.js front-end
•	Development of front-end application in Ember.js
•	Built JSON ontology for core patent application data
•	Built serializers to export patent application data to PDF (using ReportLab) and Microsoft Word 

Technologies used: Python, Django, Ember.js, Javascript, Handlebars, Git, CircleCI, AWS Opsworks, ReportLab
profile_positions.title: Senior Lead Software Engineer

Lead Backend Engineer, Web API developer & scrum master

profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description: • Worked on a Rails web app to handle the application, enrollment, and payment process for Codefellows students.
profile_positions.title: Ruby on Rails Developer

profile_positions.description:
•	Defined internationalization features of e-Tourism product seekda connect.
•	Business development in North America for e-Tourism product seekda connect.
•	Leading research project proposals authoring in Semantic Web, Web Services and mobile services domains.  
•	Consultancy in ongoing research projects ‘Insemtives’ (Motivating user participation on seekda Web Service portal) and ‘Service-Detective’ (Web service crawling and clustering).
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant, US Representative

profile_positions.description:
Head of research (since 2010), Project Manager and Researcher. Coordination of applied research and innovation strategy in seekda. 
•	Managed seekda participation in 5 international and national research projects ('Insemtives', 'SOA4All', 'Service-Finder', 'Service-Detective', 'Service Bundler') with a total budget of €1,600k. Application areas: Semantic Web, Web Services and Web extraction. Contributions: requirement and functional specifications; focused crawling, ranking, and data mining implementations; creation of motivational user challenges for Web Service portal.
•	Lead of focused crawling, data analysis and data mining activities (Web Services and e-Tourism domains). Design of crawling and data analysis framework, and joint implementation.
• Development and maintenance of the seekda Web Service search engine (http://webservices.seekda.com). 
• Co-authoring two successful project proposals: ‘Service Bundler’, in the area of Web Service composition, acquiring €300K for 2 partners (€210K for seekda GmbH) and ‘Smart Reality’, integrating augmented reality and location-based services for mobile devices, acquiring €402K for 4 partners (€90K for seekda GmbH). 
• Advisor of MSc student’s thesis work in the areas of Web Service annotations and classification. 

Technologies used: Java, the Internet Archive Heritrix Web Crawler, Web Service technologies (WSDL, SOAP, AXIS, REST), data/knowledge representation formats XML and RDF, PostgreSQL, Virtuoso Triple Store, RapidMiner and JavaScript.
profile_positions.title: Head of research

profile_positions.description:
• Co-authored a successful project proposal (‘Service-Detective’) in the area of Web Service crawling, automatic service annotation and service clustering; acquiring €231K for 3 partners (€197K for the University of Innsbruck, €57K for seekda GmbH).  
• Co-authored a number of book chapters and peer-reviewed publications, in the fields of reasoning, Web Crawling, Semantic Web, Web Service discovery and Web Service ranking.  
• Taught in the computer science MSc (lecture and seminar) programs. Tutor at Semantic Web Services Winter Retreat, March 2009, Seefeld, Austria. 
• Advisor of BSc student thesis work (2008) in the area of Semantic Web languages.
profile_positions.title: Research Advisor

profile_positions.description:
•	Managed and delivered contributions as researcher in national and international projects (theoretical research deliverables; prototype implementations). Domains: Semantic Web languages, Web Service discovery, reasoning
• Chaired two working groups (4-odd and 10-odd people) tasked (a) to develop methods for discovery and ranking of Semantic Web Services and (b) to implement a language framework for the Semantic Web and Semantic Web Services. 
• Taught in the computer science BSc (lab and seminar). 

Technologies used: Java for research prototypes, Web Service technologies (WSDL, SOAP, AXIS) for deployment of reasoning and data format transformation services.
profile_positions.title: Research Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description: I brought Django Girls to Seattle, and am still one of the organizers of the Seattle chapter of Django Girls. We organize full-day, free programming workshops in Seattle, targeting women with none or little experience in the tech world. Learn more about the program at https://djangogirls.org/.

The Seattle chapter of Girl Geek Dinners (SGGD), founded 2008, is inspired by the original Girl Geek Dinners founded in London based on one mission – to embrace being girly and geeky! Our mission: to create an informal platform where technical girls and women of all ages can network and learn from others alike in our local community.

•	Design, set-up and maintenance of new SGGD website (http://www.seattlegirlgeekdinners.com/) on Wordpress
•	Design of Seattle specific logo
•	Set-up of job board and mailing list

National Organizer (since 2014), following National Meetup Coordinator & Local Chapter Lead position.

Hack The People (http://hackthepeople.org/) is a non-profit organization that strives to enhance and increase the number of mentor and mentee relationships in the technical community. Being lent a helping hand or giving back and sharing your wealth of knowledge is paramount to us.

We are in the process of building a community of meetups spread throughout the US. We’re trying to get people in the same room to work on the same problem and learn from one another.

Currently we have chapters of Hack The People in NYC/NJ, in Stanford/Silicon Valley, in Portland, and two in the Seattle area.
